text: St. Nicolas Church is a church in Nuneaton, operated by the Church of England. The building dates back to the first half of the 14th century. It was badly damaged during the Second World War. After the war, it was rebuilt by prisoners of war. Today, it is a Grade I listed building. ==References== Category:Anglican churches in England Category:Listed buildings Category:Buildings and structures in Warwickshire Category:14th-century buildings and structures
title: St Nicolas Church, Nuneaton
